data.title: Awesome Bakery and More!
data.text: A great place for gourmet coffee drinks and all the bakery fixings to go with it.  Cases full of pastries, sandwiches, salads, quiches and more.  They also have the best breads in town.  Definitely a stop to make when you are in Kirkland!

data.title: Coffee after Breakfast
data.text: 6 of us enjoyed a hearty breakfast at a local restaurant but wanted "great" coffee afterwards. We walked across the street to Aura Bakery and Coffee Bar. We were too full to taste all the tempting treats in the bakery. We ordered cafe lattes, cafe mocha, a tea and Americano. The lattes and mocha were works of "art." The lattes were smooth in texture and taste. We will be back!

data.title: Poor service.
data.text: This bakery has a good collection of cakes and pastries, and is conveniently located in Kirkland.  As we walked in around 4ish of a Friday afternoon, we didn't get any kind of smile or 'hello' or 'how's it going' there were 2 members of staff behind the counter, they continued to talk behind the counter to themselves, they looked like they really didn't want to be there, and we were inconveniencing them.  We looked at the selection of cakes and waited for someone to take our order.  The people behind the counter seemed inexperienced and depressed.  After paying we sat to have our cake.  The floor was really dirty.  The cake was just ok, nothing special.  I continued to watch the staff and they continued to talk behind the counter.  Ok for a quick bite, don't think I will go back, the experience wasn't great.

data.title: Breakfast before work
data.text: We were looking for something other than hotel fare and stumbled across this gem. Beautiful pastries and fantastic coffee, yes better than the green goddess. The barista took great pride in specially crafting our drinks. Wait until 9 on weekdays if you fancy something more than pastries.

data.title: Delicious pastries/food and beautifully prepared espresso drinks
data.text: The baristas at Aura Bakery & Coffee Bar take their drink preparation very seriously and the taste shows it!  They always have a huge assortment of fresh, made on premises, pastries and macarons.  Their lunch selection is relatively small but huge on flavor.  A "must stop" every time I'm in the area.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: We got an assortment of dishes, and everything we stuck in our mouths was delicious... which marks this as a dangerous place to go. I am better off not knowing how fabulous pastries can be. Or perhaps getting boxes to share with groups? A real treat.

data.title: Good spot for lunch in Kirkland
data.text: I recently went for a business lunch.  I had a turkey sandwich on a baguette which was very good.  You order at the counter then find a table.  It's in a great location and easy to find.

data.title: Palmiers are awesome!!
data.text: I ended up visiting this place on my wife's recommendation, it was just spot on. Pastries are very very good, you can have your favorite coffee with one of this delicious goodies on any rainy day.

data.title: A fine french bakery but not much else to offer for variety
data.text:
You order at the counter and seat yourself.

The coffee was fine created with artistry.

The pastries were also beautiful but exclusively croissants of various flavors which aren't particularly what we wanted.

Great if this is what you want but we will likely look elsewhere next time.

data.title: Authentic Parisian bakery, and best cafe au lait around
data.text:
This has been one of our favorite breakfast spots for the past couple of years that we have lived in Kirkland. It is like having a little piece of Paris right in Washington. There are of course other French bakeries scattered throughout the Seattle area, but in my opinion Aura pulls off the closest authenticity of typical boulangeries/patisseries you would find in Paris. The crepes are fantastic, as is the quiche and croque madame sandwiches. As for the reviewer who stated that the croissants are "too flaky", I'm afraid they don't know what a true croissant is. The croissants at Aura are excellent and baked fresh daily from scratch, unlike the doughy preservative-filled "croissants" at Starbucks. Many of the savory menu items come with a delicious simple green salad with tasty vinaigrette that is not overpowering.

The café au lait is the best coffee I have had in the Seattle area, and rivals some of the better coffee I've had in France, although it can be a little inconsistent depending on who makes it. 

The owner is very friendly and polite, and has often offered to clear our table or ask if we have everything we need. 

The only improvements that come to mind are 1) that it is often very harshly noisy when it is busy -- I wish they would add some kind of noise dampening to the ceiling; and 2), as with any place in downtown Kirkland, parking can be very difficult to find on a weekend. 

I also have a request for Aura to add moelleux au chocolat a la Paul Bakery to their desert items -- my favorite!

data.title: Go French
data.text: One of several coffee shops in a small area. Don't pass by. This is worth a stop. There were a lot of pastry choices and the espresso/lattes were great. I would definitely return.

data.title: The best French Bakery and coffe in the region
data.text: I love French cuisine and to find a French bakery like Aura is fantastic. Very traditional French pastries, high quality and you can see the bakers and the "chef pastissiers" working while you are eating. Great coffee and some other savory dishes. A must go place if you are in Kirkland.

data.title: Desserts
data.text: Coffee art is so beautiful. Have pretty much tried all the pastries here because I found out the owners was our neighbor. Fruit is my favorite but the bakery makes beautiful and very good desserts. We had peanut milk chocolate cake. Taste like snicker crust peanut butter cake. My Daugther had lemon tart and I had blueberry raspberry fruit tart.

data.title: DELICOUS!!!!
data.text: I have not had a bad item here.  Everything is delicious and so much selection it's hard to choose.  Get there early or take it with you, as everyone else in Kirkland loves it here too...always packed...which is not a bad sign :)

data.title: Great new bakery & coffee shop
data.text: Going into the Aura Bakery and seeing the long pastry case with colorful baked goods reminds me of some of the wonderful bakeries in Germany, France, and Belgium.  Presentation is everything!  The sandwiches and pastries are great, and this is a real hopping place.  We love this new coffee spot/cafe in Kirkland!

data.title: Aura has elevated Kirkland's palate! Magnifique!
data.text: Want a wonderful cappuccino or pastry in Seattle, make the drive over to the Eastside for this incredible experience for your palate.  French everything, sandwiches, quiches, pastry, bread.  This shop is passionate about their food and it shows!  Go to Aura, you will be happy that you did!

data.title: Everything is delicious!
data.text: Since I've moved to Kirkland, I only go to Aura bakery. I am a big fan of bakeries and I must say that this is one of the best ones I've been to. The pastries are amazing, everything I've ordered is delicious and the list is very long. You really can't go wrong. The staff is friendly and there is always a great atmosphere at the bakery.

data.title: Attention Graduates of the School of Dessert
data.text:
Granted, no such school exist yet there is an unspoken bond people have who love dessert. Oh my, you grads are going to love this place. Yes, the coffee is very good (as a visitor for three weeks, it doesn't take long to become immersed in WA coffee semantics and habit) but it's the baked goods that bring a smile of anticipation. Many choices, my favorite in my time in Kirkland, the Lemon Tarte with a small, one person carrot cake a close second. The macaroons are in a class by themselves.

Don't take my word for it, bring your happiness to Aura.

data.title: A small gem in Kirkland
data.text: The display has a large number of beautiful french style pastries, and an enormous selection of macaroons.  The coffee is excellent and the pastries I have tried are wonderful.  I have only tasted a part of one sandwich, but the bread and combinations were also excellent.  I highly recommend this bakery for a special treat or for just a cup of great, carefully prepared coffee.  The bakers are near the back and you can watch them making the fresh and beautiful pastries.

data.title: Good bakery - fruit tarts rock
data.text:
Only had (between us) a sweet roll and a fruit tart, but the two were both very, very good. Service was good, price was a tad high but it's a deluxe bakery, so I don't think ti was unreasonable.

Did not try the coffee, sorry.
